description: Number of triangular regions in regular n-gon with all diagonals drawn.
links: B. Poonen and M. Rubinstein, Number of Intersection Points Made by the Diagonals of a Regular Polygon, SIAM J. Discrete Mathematics, Vol. 11, pp. 135-156.
B. Poonen and M. Rubinstein, The number of intersection points made by the diagonals of a regular polygon, SIAM J. on Discrete Mathematics, Vol. 11, No. 1, 135-156 (1998).
S. E. Sommars and T. Sommars, Number of Triangles Formed by Intersecting Diagonals of a Regular Polygon, J. Integer Sequences, 1 (1998), #98.1.5.
Sequences formed by drawing all diagonals in regular polygon
example: a(4) = 4 because in a quadrilateral the diagonals cross to make four triangles.
author: _Sascha Kurz_, Jul 07 2001
